channel.title: ::pickup problem

item.title: ::pickup problem
item.dc:creator: @Darkning Darkning
item.description:
@Darkning wrote:

if (command.startsWith("pickup") && playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(" ")) { String[] args = command.split(" "); if(args.length == 3) { int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(args[1]); int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(args[2]); if (newItemID <= 160000 && newItemID >= 0) { addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount); } else { sM("No such item."); } } else { sM("Oops! Use as ::pickup 995 100"); } } }

item.title: ::pickup problem
item.dc:creator: @_James_scape _James_scape
item.description:
@_James_scape wrote:

do

   if (command.startsWith("pickup") && playerRights == 3) {
          String[] args = command.split(" ");
        if(args.length == 3) {
     int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(args[1]);
     int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(args[2]);
     if (newItemID <= 160000 && newItemID >= 0) {
        addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount);
     } else {
        sM("No such item.");
     }
  } else {
     sM("Oops! Use as ::pickup 995 100");
  }
   }

}

item.title: ::pickup problem
item.dc:creator: @Mishots Mishots
item.description:
@Mishots wrote:

try replacing yours with the one i have, it is set to only owners. and works fine on my server.

if (command.startsWith("pickup") && playerRights >= 3) { String[] args = command.split(" "); if(args.length == 3) { int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(args[1]); int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(args[2]); if (newItemID <= 160000 && newItemID >= 0) { addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount); } else { sM("No such item."); } } else { sM("Oops! Use as ::pickup 995 100"); } }

I think your problem was that you had it set to rights above 3 only. It should be greater than or equal to 3.

Read full topic

item.title: ::pickup problem

item.description:
@Maximum_ZxZ wrote:

[quote=“Natey, post:2, topic:290323”]if (command.startsWith(“pickup”) && playerRights > 1) {
String[] args = command.split(" ");
if(args.length == 3) {
int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(args[1]);
int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(args[2]);
if (newItemID <= 160000 && newItemID >= 0) {
addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount);
} else {
sM(“No such item.”);
}
} else {
sM(“Oops! Use as ::pickup 995 100”);
}
}
}[/quote]

Can’t you read ? I said I put for Owner (PlayerRights = 3) But in-game, it let Moderator and Administrator do ::pickup to. I need to fix it and only put ::pickup for me (Owner).

item.title: ::pickup problem
item.dc:creator: @Maximum_ZxZ Maximum ZxZ
item.description:
@Maximum_ZxZ wrote:

I got pickup for only Owner but in-game, it let the Moderator spawn and Administrator to.

Here’s the code I put:

    if (command.startsWith("pickup") && playerRights > 3) {
	        String[] args = command.split(" ");
         if(args.length == 3) {
		int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(args[1]);
		int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(args[2]);
		if (newItemID <= 160000 && newItemID >= 0) {
			addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount);
		} else {
			sM("No such item.");
		}
	} else {
		sM("Oops! Use as ::pickup 995 100");
	}
    }

}

Can you help me put only ::pickup for Owner only please ?

Read full topic
